channel.title: Brandon Boswell
channel.description: Recent content from Brandon Boswell's Digital Garden

item.title: Death Stranding
item.description: According to HowLongToBeat it takes 40.5 hours, and I am 16.75 hours in.
item.content:encoded: According to HowLongToBeat it takes 40.5 hours, and I am 16.75 hours in.

item.title: Control
item.description: According to HowLongToBeat it takes 11.5 hours (13 hours on Ultimate Edition) to beat, and I am 10.3 hours in. I should go ahead and finish it.
item.content:encoded: According to HowLongToBeat it takes 11.5 hours (13 hours on Ultimate Edition) to beat, and I am 10.3 hours in. I should go ahead and finish it.

item.title: Forza Horizon 5
item.description: A ton of fun, but we never ended up picking it up as a friend group and playing the single player piece at the computer is not as fun as it would be in the living room.
item.content:encoded: A ton of fun, but we never ended up picking it up as a friend group and playing the single player piece at the computer is not as fun as it would be in the living room.

item.title: PHOGS!
item.description: Played with Charlie Boswell Put down when Xbox Game Pass ended
item.content:encoded: Played with Charlie Boswell Put down when Xbox Game Pass ended

item.title: Dominion

Board Games

item.title: Pandemic
item.description: Pandemic Recommended by Jake Played it. It’s only okay. It’s basically a Forbidden Island for adults
item.content:encoded:
• Pandemic
    • Recommended by Jake
    • Played it.
    • It’s only okay.
    • It’s basically a Forbidden Island for adults

item.title: Harry Potter Hogwart's Battle
item.description: Board Games Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle Pros Simple Easy to Pick Up The location counters changing the difficulty feels really cool (Basically becomes different phases of the game) Cons Only basic mechanics
item.content:encoded:
Board Games

  • Harry Potter Hogwarts Battle Pros

    • Simple

    • Easy to Pick Up

    • The location counters changing the difficulty feels really cool (Basically becomes different phases of the game) Cons

    • Only basic mechanics

    • No way to break the game (feels grindy)

    • The fact the villains don’t attack you feels anti-climactic

    • The cards you choose to draft don’t significantly change your outcome

    • No real tradeoff decisions when drafting cards

    • Cards stick around instead of having a limited window with which to purchase them.

item.title: Betrayal at house on the hill
